intro: Malmea dielsiana, commonly known as the Diels' malmea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, pod-like fruits. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially available.
